head.title: Arts, Briefly; Pop Charts: Another Week, Another No. 1

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Music, Theater and Dance

hedline.hl1: Arts, Briefly; Pop Charts: Another Week, Another No. 1

body.head.byline: By BEN SISARIO; Compiled by Lawrence Van Gelder

abstract.p: Arts, Briefly column; Audioslave's new album enters Billboard charts at top of list; photo (S)

block.p: For the seventh week in a row, a new album has entered the Billboard charts at No.1. Not since 50 Cent's ''Massacre'' (Interscope) ended its six-week run in April has any new album stayed at the top for more than seven days. This week's chart is led by Audioslave's ''Out of Exile'' (Interscope/Epic), which sold 263,000 copies, according to Nielsen SoundScan. In a relatively strong week of sales, the rapper Common's new album, ''Be'' (Geffen), left, entered at No.2 with 185,00 copies sold, and last week's No.1, System of a Down's ''Mezmerize'' (American/Columbia), dropped to No. 4, with a 63 percent sales slide, to 169,000 units. Meanwhile, Mariah Carey's ''Emancipation of Mimi'' (Island/Def Jam) is proving a durable hit, holding at No.3 in its seventh week of release. Coldplay's ''X&Y,'' to be released on Tuesday, is expected to be a summer hit, but sales may be jeopardized by an Internet leak. The BBC reported that an unauthorized version appeared online on Monday, just before it was to be sent to British radio stations and sold in Japan.

Meanwhile, Mariah Carey's ''Emancipation of Mimi'' (Island/Def Jam) is proving a durable hit, holding at No.3 in its seventh week of release. Coldplay's ''X&Y,'' to be released on Tuesday, is expected to be a summer hit, but sales may be jeopardized by an Internet leak. The BBC reported that an unauthorized version appeared online on Monday, just before it was to be sent to British radio stations and sold in Japan.
